#coding: utf-8
import workflow

import webbrowser
from ftplib import FTP

# Get the custom parameters as a dictionary (titles are keys):
params = workflow.get_parameters()
# Get the action's input (a string):
action_in = workflow.get_input()

##############################
##### FTP Protocol Class #####
##############################

class FTP_Instance:
	def __init__(self):
		self.initial_path = params['Initial_Path']
		self.ftp = FTP(params['FTP_Server'])
		self.ftp.login(params['FTP_Username'], params['FTP_Password'])
		self.ftp.cwd(self.initial_path)

	def open_file(self, filename, path):
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		temp = open('temp', "wb")
		self.ftp.retrbinary('RETR ' + filename, temp.write)
		temp.close()
		read = open('temp', 'r')
		file_contents = read.read()
		read.close()
		return file_contents

	def check_file_exists(self, filename, path):
		existing_files = self.ftp.nlst(path)
		return filename in existing_files
		
	def mkd(self, path):
		checked_path = ''
		directories = path[1:].split('/')
		self.ftp.cwd(self.initial_path)
		for i in range(len(directories)):
			current_dir = self.ftp.nlst(self.initial_path + checked_path)
			if directories[i] in current_dir:
				checked_path += '/' + directories[i]
				self.ftp.cwd(self.initial_path + checked_path)
			else:
				checked_path += '/' + directories[i]
				self.ftp.mkd(self.initial_path + checked_path)
				self.ftp.cwd(self.initial_path + checked_path)
		
	def overwrite_file(self, filename, text, path):
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		file = open('temp', 'w')
		file.write(text)
		file.close()
		file = open('temp', 'r')
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		self.ftp.storbinary('STOR ' + filename, file)
		if text != self.open_file(filename,path):
			console.hud_alert('File Overwrite Failed', 'error', 5.0)
		else:
			console.hud_alert('File Overwritten', 'success', 5.0)
		file.close()
	
	def upload_image(self, imagename, path):
		image = photos.pick_image()
		buffer = BytesIO()
		image.save(buffer, 'PNG')
		buffer.seek(0)
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		self.ftp.storbinary('STOR ' + imagename, buffer)
	
	def create_and_upload_file(self, filename, text, path):
		file = open('temp', 'w')
		file.write(text)
		file.close()
		file = open('temp', 'r')
		self.upload_file(file, filename, path)
		file.close()

	def upload_file(self, file, filename, path):
		if path != '':
			self.mkd(path)
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		self.ftp.storbinary('STOR ' + filename, file)

	def print_directory(self, path):
		print self.ftp.nlst(path)
		
	def duplicate_file(self, filename, path):
		i = 1
		find_extension = filename.split('.')
		new_filename = ''
		for n in range(len(find_extension)-1):
			new_filename += find_extension[n] + '.'
		new_filename = new_filename[:-1]
		check_filename = new_filename + '-' + str(i) + '.' + find_extension[n+1]
		file_contents = self.open_file(filename, path)
		while self.check_file_exists(check_filename, path):
			i += 1
			check_filename = new_filename + '-' + str(i) + '.' + find_extension[n+1]
		self.create_and_upload_file(check_filename, file_contents, path)
		
	def duplicate_folder(self, foldername, path):
		i = 1
		new_foldername = foldername + '-' + str(i)
		while self.check_file_exists(new_foldername, path):
			i += 1
			new_foldername = foldername + '-' + str(i)
		self.ftp.mkd(path + '/' + new_foldername)
		# Get directory to duplicate as dictionary with keys marking items as files or folders
		dir_items = ftp.directory_with_types(path + '/' + foldername)
		for item in dir_items:
			if dir_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
				file_contents = self.open_file(dir_items[item]['title'], path + '/' + foldername)
				self.create_and_upload_file(dir_items[item]['title'], file_contents, path + '/' + new_foldername)
			else:
				if dir_items[item]['title'][:1] != '.':
					self.ftp.mkd(path + '/' + new_foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
					items_in_folder = self.ftp.nlst(path + '/' + foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
					items_to_duplicate = False
					for folderitem in items_in_folder:
						if folderitem[:1] != '.':
							items_to_duplicate = True
					if items_to_duplicate == True:
						self.duplicate_folder_helper(dir_items[item]['title'], path + '/' + foldername, path + '/' + new_foldername)
	# Helper action
	def duplicate_folder_helper(self, foldername, from_path, to_path):
		# Get directory to duplicate as dictionary with keys marking items as files or folders
		dir_items = ftp.directory_with_types(from_path + '/' + foldername)
		for item in dir_items:
			if dir_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
				file_contents = self.open_file(dir_items[item]['title'], from_path + '/' + foldername)
				self.create_and_upload_file(dir_items[item]['title'], file_contents, to_path + '/' + foldername)
			else:
				if dir_items[item]['title'][:1] != '.':
					self.ftp.mkd(to_path + '/' + foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
					items_in_folder = self.ftp.nlst(from_path + '/' + foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
					items_to_duplicate = False
					for folderitem in items_in_folder:
						if folderitem[:1] != '.':
							items_to_duplicate = True
					if items_to_duplicate == True:
						self.duplicate_folder_helper(dir_items[item]['title'], from_path + '/' + foldername, to_path + '/' + foldername)

	def move_file(self, filename, from_path, to_path):
		if not self.check_file_exists(filename, to_path):
			file_contents = self.open_file(filename, from_path)
			self.create_and_upload_file(filename, file_contents, to_path)
			if self.check_file_exists(filename, to_path):
				if self.open_file(filename, to_path) == file_contents:
					self.ftp.cwd(from_path)
					self.ftp.delete(filename)
		else:
			console.hud_alert('File with same name already exists in this location', 'error', 5.0)
			
	def move_folder(self, foldername, from_path, to_path):
		all_files_moved = True
		if not self.check_file_exists(foldername, to_path):
			self.ftp.mkd(to_path + '/' + foldername)
			# Get directory of folder contents to be moved
			dir_items = ftp.directory_with_types(from_path + '/' + foldername)
			for item in dir_items:
				if dir_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
					file_contents = self.open_file(dir_items[item]['title'], from_path + '/' + foldername)
					self.create_and_upload_file(dir_items[item]['title'], file_contents, to_path + '/' + foldername)
					if not self.check_file_exists(dir_items[item]['title'], to_path + '/' + foldername):
						all_files_moved = False
						print 'false'
				else:
					if dir_items[item]['title'][:1] != '.':
						self.ftp.mkd(to_path + '/' + foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
						items_in_folder = self.ftp.nlst(from_path + '/' + foldername + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
						items_to_duplicate = False
						for folderitem in items_in_folder:
							if folderitem[:1] != '.':
								items_to_duplicate = True
						if items_to_duplicate == True:
							self.duplicate_folder_helper(dir_items[item]['title'], from_path + '/' + foldername, to_path + '/' + foldername)
		else:
			console.hud_alert('Folder of same name already exists in this location', 'error', 5.0)
			return
		if all_files_moved:
			self.delete_folder(foldername, from_path)
		else:
			console.hud_alert('All files may not have been moved', 'error')
							
	def delete_folder(self, foldername, path):
		ftp.delete_folder_helper(path + '/' + foldername)
		ftp.ftp.cwd(path)
		ftp.ftp.rmd(foldername)
	# Helper action
	def delete_folder_helper(self, path):
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		dir_items = ftp.directory_with_types(path)
		for item in dir_items:
			if dir_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
				self.ftp.delete(dir_items[item]['title'])
			else:
				if dir_items[item]['title'][:1] != '.':
					items_in_folder = self.ftp.nlst(path + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
					items_inside = False
					for folderitem in items_in_folder:
						if folderitem[:1] != '.':
							items_inside = True
					if items_inside == True:
						save_path = path
						self.delete_folder_helper(path + '/' + dir_items[item]['title'])
						self.ftp.cwd(save_path)
						self.ftp.rmd(dir_items[item]['title'])
					else:
						self.ftp.rmd(dir_items[item]['title'])
		
	def directory_with_types(self, path):
		i = 0
		directory_list = []
		directory_dict = {}
		title_list = self.ftp.nlst(path)
		self.ftp.cwd(path)
		self.ftp.retrlines('LIST', callback=directory_list.append)
		for item in directory_list:
			if i < len(title_list):
				listing = {}
				if item.upper().startswith('D'):
					listing['type'] = 'folder'
				else:
					listing['type'] = 'file'
				directory_dict[i] = listing
				directory_dict[i]['title'] = title_list[i]
				i += 1
		return directory_dict

	def quit(self):
		self.ftp.quit()

##########################
##### FTP UI Client ######
##########################

# Initiate FTP Connection
ftp = FTP_Instance()

# Build directory to be displayed in rows of file manager
def build_directory(path=params['Initial_Path']):
	# Get directory as dictionary with keys marking items as files or folders
	list_items = ftp.directory_with_types(path)
	source_list = []
	# Pull data from list_items and prepare a list of dictionaries readable by ListDataSource element
	for item in list_items:
		d = {}
		d['title'] = list_items[item]['title']
		# For files, do not include accessory action icons in their rows, but mark them with file icons
		if list_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
			d['accessory_type'] = 'none'
			d['image'] = 'ionicons-document-24'
		# For folders, add chevron arrow accessory action icons to rows and mark with folder icons
		else:
			d['accessory_type'] = 'detail_disclosure_button'
			d['image'] = 'ionicons-folder-24'
		# Add each prepared dictionary to overall list of dictionaries
		if d['title'][:1] != '.':
			source_list.append(d)
	# Return list of dictionaries with all files and folders properly flagged	
	return source_list

###############
# Back Button #
###############
# Action to be run when user taps the back button in the top left of the UI
def back_button_tapped(sender):
	if not sender.superview.secondary_actions.hidden:
		sender.superview.secondary_actions.hidden = True
		sender.superview.secondary_button1.enabled = True
		sender.superview.file_label.editable = False
		button_actions_closed = False
	elif not sender.superview.button_actions.hidden:
		sender.superview.plus_button.enabled = True
		sender.superview.button_actions.hidden = True
		sender.superview.file_label.editable = False
		button_actions_closed = False
		if sender.superview.path_field.text == '/':
			sender.superview.back_button.enabled = False
	else:
		button_actions_closed = True
	
	if button_actions_closed == True:
		# Get current path
		path = sender.superview.path_field.text
		# Split the path at slashes
		path = path.split('/')
		new_path = ''
		# Put the path back together with slashes, but leave the final path item removed (path is back one level)
		for i in range(len(path) - 1):
			new_path += path[i] + '/'
		# Remove trailing backslash, unless you are in the top level directory '/'
		if len(new_path) > 1:
			new_path = new_path[:-1]
		# Build the directory for the new path and send it to the ListDataSource element
		sender.superview.list_source.items = build_directory(new_path)
		# Adjust the title TextField to display the new path
		sender.superview.path_field.text = ftp.ftp.pwd()
		# If the new path leaves you at the top level directory, disable the back button
		if new_path == '/':
			sender.enabled = False

		selection = tableview.data_source.items[row]['title']
		# If selected item is a folder...
		if tableview.data_source.items[row]['accessory_type'] != 'none':
			# Build the new directory
			if tableview.superview.path_field.text[-1:] != '/':
				tableview.superview.list_source.items = build_directory(tableview.superview.path_field.text + '/' + selection)

#######################
# Path Field Delegate #
#######################
class path_navigation_delegate():
	def textfield_should_begin_editing(self,textfield):
		return True
	# When user hits return after editing TextField...
	def textfield_should_return(self,textfield):
		# Get the current path from the text field
		self.path = textfield.text
		# Test to see if the new path is a valid directory...
		try:
			# If it is, build that directory and load it into the ListDataSource element
			textfield.superview.list_source.items = build_directory(self.path)
		except:
			# If it is not a valid path, alert the user and reset the path in the TextField to what it was previously
			console.hud_alert('Directory \'' + self.path + '\' Does Not Seem To Exist', 'error', 5.0)
			textfield.text = ftp.ftp.pwd()
		textfield.end_editing()
	# If keyboard is dismissed without return being hit, reset the path in the TextField to the current directory
	def textfield_did_end_editing(self,textfield):
		textfield.text = ftp.ftp.pwd()
		
#######################
# File Label Delegate #
#######################
class file_label_delegate():
	def __init__(self, textview, type):
		self.type = type
	def textview_should_begin_editing(self, textview):
		return True
	def textview_did_begin_editing(self, textview):
		if self.type == 'upload':
			textview.text = 'filename.txt'
		elif self.type == 'new_folder':
			textview.text = 'foldername'
		elif self.type == 'new_image':
			textview.text = 'imagename.png'
	def textview_did_end_editing(self, textview):
		textview.text = textview.name
	def textview_should_change(self, textview, range, replacement):
		return True
	def textview_did_change(self, textview):
		if self.type == 'upload' or self.type == 'new_folder' or self.type == 'new_image':
			textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1.enabled = True
		if '\n' in textview.text:
			textview.text = textview.text.rstrip('\n')
			textview.end_editing()
			if textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1.enabled == True:
				if self.type == 'folder':
					rename_folder(textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1)
				elif self.type == 'file':
					rename_file(textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1)
				elif self.type == 'upload':
					upload_file_in_editor(textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1)
				elif self.type == 'new_folder':
					create_folder(textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1)
				elif self.type == 'new_image':
					upload_image(textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1)
		if self.type != 'upload' and self.type != 'new_folder' and self.type != 'new_image':
			if textview.text != textview.name:
				textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1.enabled = True
			else:
				textview.superview.superview.secondary_button1.enabled = False
	def textview_did_change_selection(self, textview):
		pass

class move_delegate():
	def tableview_did_select(self, tableview, section, row):
		# Save title of tapped row
		selection = tableview.data_source.items[row]['title']
		# If selected item is a folder...
		if tableview.data_source.items[row]['accessory_type'] != 'none':
			# Build the new directory
			if tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text[-1:] != '/':
				tableview.superview.superview.move_list_source.items = build_move_directory(tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text + '/' + selection)
			else:
				tableview.superview.superview.move_list_source.items = build_directory(tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text + selection)
			# Set text field to display new path
			tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text = ftp.ftp.pwd()
			tableview.superview.superview.select_folder.title =  'Move to \'' + tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text + '\''
			# Enable the back button if you are no longer on the top level directory
			if tableview.superview.superview.move_path_field.text != '/':
				tableview.superview.superview.move_back_button.enabled = True

# Build directory to be displayed in rows of TableView for moving files
def build_move_directory(path=params['Initial_Path']):
	# Get directory as dictionary with keys marking items as files or folders
	list_items = ftp.directory_with_types(path)
	source_list = []
	# Pull data from list_items and prepare a list of dictionaries readable by ListDataSource element
	for item in list_items:
		d = {}
		d['title'] = list_items[item]['title']
		# For files, do not include accessory action icons in their rows, but mark them with file icons
		if list_items[item]['type'] == 'file':
			d['accessory_type'] = 'none'
			d['image'] = 'ionicons-document-24'
		# For folders, add chevron arrow accessory action icons to rows and mark with folder icons
		else:
			d['accessory_type'] = 'disclosure_indicator'
			d['image'] = 'ionicons-folder-24'
		# Add each prepared dictionary to overall list of dictionaries
		if d['title'][:1] != '.':
			source_list.append(d)
	# Return list of dictionaries with all files and folders properly flagged	
	return source_list

#####################################
def move_back_button_tapped(sender):
	# Get current path
	path = sender.superview.superview.move_path_field.text
	# Split the path at slashes
	path = path.split('/')
	new_path = ''
	# Put the path back together with slashes, but leave the final path item removed (path is back one level)
	for i in range(len(path) - 1):
		new_path += path[i] + '/'
	# Remove trailing backslash, unless you are in the top level directory '/'
	if len(new_path) > 1:
		new_path = new_path[:-1]
	# Build the directory for the new path and send it to the ListDataSource element
	sender.superview.superview.move_list_source.items = build_move_directory(new_path)
	# Adjust the title TextField to display the new path
	sender.superview.superview.move_path_field.text = ftp.ftp.pwd()
	sender.superview.superview.select_folder.title = 'Move to \'' + sender.superview.superview.move_path_field.text + '\''
	# If the new path leaves you at the top level directory, disable the back button
	if new_path == '/':
		sender.enabled = False

# Build the initial directory and store it to the source_list variable
source_list = build_directory()

# Initiate the view and pass it the source_list
view = FTP_Client(source_list)
# Present the view in a popover
view.present(style = 'popover', hide_title_bar = True)
